description:
Cooking for others is the cook’s payoff. To cook delightful food and serve it and share it around a big table is just a joy. But cooking for others can feel hard: Everything you know as a cook gets tested. Can you choose things that taste great, but that also finish cooking at the same time? Can you cook a big dinner, on a weekend or a holiday, without getting too flustered and feeling like you can’t enjoy your own party? Today: some easy shortcuts that will help you host dinner parties fearlessly and with joy. 

Get more on hosting an (almost) stress-free dinner party here: https://www.thekitchn.com/cooking-school-dinner-party-22954321
name: A Crash Course in Dinner Parties | Cooking School
